H0.text: where did the iroquois indians come from. New York

H1.text: where did the iroquois indians come from. Ontario

H2.text: where did the iroquois indians come from. Pennsylvania

H3.text: where did the iroquois indians come from. Québec

A4.text: the Haudenosaunee were based in what is now central and west New York State including the Finger Lakes region

A5.text: At its peak around 1700, Iroquois power extended from what is today New York State, north into present-day Ontario and Quebec along the lower Great Lakes–upper St. Lawrence

A6.text: the St. Lawrence River passes through three of the six homelands of the Haudenosaunee: the Mohawk or Kanienʼkehá꞉ka, the Oneida or Onyota'a:ka, and the Onondaga or Onöñda’gaga’

A7.text: the area of present-day New York had been inhabited by tribes of the Algonquians and the Iroquois Confederacy Native Americans for several thousand years by the time the earliest Europeans arrived
